ygData.subject: RE: I won my dream item!!
ygData.msgSnippet: well, one way is to emote the roll. another way, and I do not know how this is done, is a local software glitch ... From: Mike Roach
ygData.messageBody:
well, one way is to emote the roll.
another way, and I do not know how this is done, is a local software glitch

-----Original Message-----
From: Mike Roach [mailto:Mike.Roach@...]
Sent: Friday, February 25, 2000 10:07 AM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] I won my dream item!!


From: Mike Roach <Mike.Roach@...>

I heard there was a way to cheat at the "/random 100" method of lottos too
but I have no clue how people are doing this. I have seen people joking
around and they type "/random 100 100" so the range is basically 100-100 and
if you aren't paying close attention it could slip past you but I'm not
aware of other methods to "cheat" at this. I'd be curious to know how I may
have been cheated and what methods are used so as to recognize it happening.

As a result I have been doing a "seed" type lotto method, if you have not
seen this used yet chances are you will soon. One person, usually the group
leader is designated the master looter for rare drops. Since we get loot
messages now there is no way to sneakily get around everyone knowing what
the loot is. The looter then rolls "/random 100 1000" which returns a
number like 695 for example (range of 100-1000). This number becomes the
"Seed" number and everyone then rolls 0-seed for the loot. For example,
"/random 695" and then the highest roll takes the loot.

-Faras

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Joshua R. Moore [mailto:josh@...]
> Sent: Friday, February 25, 2000 8:29 AM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] I won my dream item!!
>
>
> From: "Joshua R. Moore" <josh@...>
>
> you are lucky. There is a way to cheat at that style of
> random lottoing.
> I always prefer the 0-5 by alpha method.(Example aamberl would be 0
> james would be 1 Martyn 2 suzu 3 xyly 4 zenon 5) Randomer
> types /random 0 5
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: John_Senior@... [mailto:John_Senior@...]
> Sent: Friday, February 25, 2000 5:37 AM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] I won my dream item!!
>
>
> From: John_Senior@...
>
> I got my Flowing Black Silk Sash last night, and I only had
> to camp an hour
> for it. I got invited into the Frenzie group at about 7pm, we
> broke the
> spawn in the room (3 Bloodthirsty Ghouls). The next spawn was
> the Frenzied
> Ghoul, we killed him (quite easily infact) and the leader
> looted. Then I
> saw the word "Sash".
>
> My heart was pumping so fast as I had the chance of winning
> this fabled
> item. The first person rolled and only got a 21. I then
> rolled and it came
> up 90, the excitement of this was amazing. But, I was still
> hoping no one
> beat my roll. I sat there as people rolled and low numbers
> were appearing,
> 33, 12, 39 and 28. I had won, I was now the owner of a
> loooooverly sash. I
> equipped it and immediately noticed the difference during the
> first fight.
> Sash + Celerity makes me attack very fast.
>
> Well, there you have it. The quickest 20k I have ever earned. =)
>
> Madagan Songweaver, Bard of 39 Songs <Guardians of Light>
> Meklon, Level 12 Cleric of Innoruuk <Lords of Chaos>
> Veeshan Server
>
>
>
